etymologies: early 19th century: from French, perhaps a blend of coucou ‘cuckoo’ and alouette ‘lark’

definitions: an ungainly long-tailed Old World bird that is a large ground-dwelling member of the cuckoo family.

notes.text: Genus Centropus (and Coua), family Cuculidae: numerous species, including the Australasian pheasant coucal (Centropus phasianinus)

shortDefinitions: ungainly long-tailed Old World bird that is large ground-dwelling member of cuckoo family
